title: DLL Call into Linux Shared Object
body: I haven't tried WSL yet; I'm only researching the possibilities.  I use Cygwin to build binaries I can call from a Matlab mex file.  I could use Visual Studio, but I'm much more comfortable with gcc and other Gnu/Linux development tools.  If there was some way to call directly into a Linux shared library, I would probably drop Cygwin.  Windows may become my new favorite OS.

comments.body: This may result in frequent BSOD. Shared libraries of OSs are not designed to inject random code to each other.
